title: SAB Orbital Vehicle Could Work in Concert With Space Rider
summary:
Italian-based space transportation company SAB Launch Services is studying ways that its IOSHEX orbital vehicle could work in concert with the European Space Agency’s (ESA) Space Rider vehicle. Space Rider is an ESA-led project to develop a small uncrewed spaceplane that will enable the launch, in-orbit testing/manufacture, and return of client payloads. Development of the […]
The post SAB Orbital Vehicle Could Work in Concert With Space Rider appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Space imagery startup HEO raises $8 million
summary: Australian startup HEO, which uses space-based sensors to inspect and image objects in orbit, announced Aug. 23 it has completed an $8 million Series A funding round.

title: Chandrayaan-3 is a story of ISRO’s perseverance and triumph
summary: The success of the Chandrayaan-3 mission marks a watershed moment, as it becomes the first spacecraft to land on the moon's south pole — a region containing water ice and valuable minerals. The implication of this pioneering feat is significant, and the data and insights drawn from these tests will surely capture global attention as they will aid in future lunar missions.
